Ba≈ülangƒ±√ßta Test 19'u Ben Daha Eƒüitim Sanƒ±yordum Ve Bir Yerde Takƒ±lƒ±p Internetten Baktƒ±ƒüƒ±mda Oyunun %80 Kadarƒ±nƒ± Bitirdiƒüimi G√∂rd√ºm, Oyun Hakkƒ±nda; Oyun Grafik Ve Oynanƒ±≈ü Olarak G√ºzel, Seslendirme Bana Hi√ß G√ºzel Ve Anla≈üƒ±lƒ±r Gelmedi, Oyun Zor Deƒüil Ve √áok Sinir Bozmayacak T√ºrden Bir Oyun, Herkese Tavsiye Ederim.

Valve showed ingenuity with Portal. While I would imagine portals to be gateways to colossal scales, both in the world and its inhabitants, it's simplicity is engrossing. I felt like a baby, given a prop for an IQ test. The basic game mechanics are fully developed by the test subjects and the spatial layout. At the same time, the movement isn't completely released from its restraints, by which I mean that there are only certain spaces where the portal gun actually works. But in no way does this make it a trial and error styled game-play. It still relies on your ability to successfully connect point A and point B in surprising ways to reach the exit. 
What Valve did remember, is that - this is a game and not a test. And they did an incredible job at that by filling the test rooms with light music and giving the test subject baby an AI mother goose with witty and diabolical monologues which deliver a greater shock because you are treated like an un-impressionable human that is suddenly jolted to maturity. A maturity that needs to understand all the sardonic and physical indications of death and make a lengthy detour from the oven where the cake is baked.

I knew way before purchasing this game that it was great, so my expectations were actually high.

As a fan of puzzle games and after completing the main story, I can flatly guarantee that it is an absolutlely must if you like sci-fi puzzle games with very well structured concepts of physics that honestly shocked me the first time I saw them.

It totally exedeed all my expectations and I would extremely recommend it to almost everyone.

This game is the epitome of short but sweet. It's not a game with hours upon hours of content and incredibly deep storytelling, but it's got great platforming and gameplay, creative writing and storytelling and complex yet fun puzzles. It's a perfect game to just sit down with, relax, beat, then replay to get all the achievements later. Well worth the ‚Ç¨8 it's asking for, an apsolute bargain if you get it on sale.
